an9.82:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these five emotional shackles.
an9.82:4.3: Firstly, a mendicant isn’t free of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures. …
an9.82:4.4: These are the five emotional shackles.
an9.82:5.1: To give up these five emotional shackles you should develop the four kinds of right endeavour.
an9.82:5.3: It’s when a mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and endeavors so that bad, unwholesome qualities don’t arise.
an9.82:5.4: so that unwholesome qualities are given up …
an9.82:5.6: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that wholesome qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are completed by development.
an9.82:5.7: To give up those five emotional shackles you should develop these four kinds of right endeavour.”
